data.text: @ElevenXianSheng @manyapan from a position of political calculation, it just feels like “we locked 200 people up in an office building and left them to fend for themselves like it’s one of those kdramas about zombies” is sort of a misstep is all
@PFemme2 @manyapan China is clinging to covid-zero in spite of any costs because a) Xi's reputation depends on it, and b) the Chinese vaccines suck and those of us here have very little protection.
@ElevenXianSheng @manyapan right, i admit to not really understanding that aspect either.

@sandylanceley @ubud_id @manyapan thank you!!! “trapping 200 people in the same non-living-space together b/c some number of them tested positive” = not a public health initiative i ever heard of. even my university, which has done a terrible job, set aside a separate dorm so students could isolate. good lord.
@ubud_id @PFemme2 @manyapan Believe it or not, you don’t have to impose authoritarian orders like this to best manage covid. A caring govt would easily get those people home safely.
@ubud_id @manyapan i mean, if you contain 200 people together without adequate care, they’re going to infect one another.
@PFemme2 @manyapan Yeah, it is more rational to let Covid spread like hellfire.
